title: Why did Congressional Reconstruction end in 1877?

content.question: Why did Congressional Reconstruction end in 1877?

choices.label: The freed slaves had been successfully integrated into Southern society.
The treaty ending the Civil War had set such a time limit.
Most of the politically active Black people had left the South for Northern cities.
The Republican and Democratic parties effected a compromise agreement after the 1876 presidential election.
The United States needed the troops stationed in the South to confront the French in Mexico.

content.answer: The Republican and Democratic parties effected a compromise agreement after the 1876 presidential election.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
